description: Evaluation sets for feedback synthesis quality testing. Each set tests different aspects of clustering, labeling, and coverage.

rubric: 1. Cluster membership stays stable across repeated runs on the same dataset
2. Labels are short, specific, and distinct; each label matches its cluster's content
3. Interest scoring produces a clear ranking with stable tie handling and no surprising inversions
4. Top interests show up early in the outline and receive proportionate coverage
5. Outliers route to a clear bucket with a visible explanation in the UI

evaluationSets.name: Clear Interest Winner
evaluationSets.description: One theme has significantly higher interest than others. Tests ranking clarity.

request.sessionSummary: Exploring modern web development tools and practices

responses.freeFormText: Very interested in how RSC handles data fetching
Would love to see examples of TypeScript generics in real code

evaluationSets.name: Tied Interest Scores
evaluationSets.description: Multiple themes with identical net scores. Tests tie-breaking stability.

responses.freeFormText: Our team struggles with context-switching due to too many meetings
Need practical examples of good code review comments

evaluationSets.name: Single Vote Items
evaluationSets.description: Themes with minimal votes. Tests edge case handling.

request.sessionSummary: Learning to pitch your startup idea effectively

evaluationSets.name: Negative Interest Dominant
evaluationSets.description: Most themes have negative interest. Tests low-interest handling.

request.sessionSummary: Strategies for migrating from legacy systems

responses.freeFormText: Most important is understanding which tests to write first
We've had bad experiences with big-bang migrations

evaluationSets.name: Freeform Feedback Heavy
evaluationSets.description: Many freeform responses but few theme votes. Tests freeform influence.

request.sessionSummary: Deploying ML models in production environments

responses.freeFormText: What about feature stores? Very interested in that topic.
How do you handle model drift over time?
CI/CD for ML pipelines is a mystery to me
Cost optimization for inference would be super helpful
How do you explain model decisions to stakeholders?

evaluationSets.name: All High Interest
evaluationSets.description: Every theme has positive interest. Tests proportionate coverage.
